task.title: Step 3 - Modify Your Web Page
task.shortdesc: These steps help you modify your Web page.

step.cmd: Open your Web page in an HTML editor.

info.p: If creating a testing Web page, create a new HTML site. The following code looks familiar if you have worked in Web page programming before:

stepresult.codeblock: <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8" /> <title>Testing Analytics Implementation</title> </head> <body></body> </html>

step.cmd: Paste the page code into the <body> tag of the HTML.

p.codeblock: This is a practice page to test Analytics and learn how to successfully implement it.

step.cmd: Create a new JavaScript file and name it s_code.js.

info.p: Paste the entire Core JavaScript File code within the file. No contents need to be altered.

step.cmd: On the Page Code, change your code to point to your s_code.js file.

info.p: For example, if you are implementing this code on adobe.com and are going to host these files in the root directory:

step.cmd: Alter the s.pageName variable to Test Page:

stepresult.p: Your Core JavaScript File and Page Code are ready. Save and upload the files to your hosting servers to be accessed from a Web browser. If you do not have access to any hosting servers, you can save them to your hard drive. Make sure the uploaded location matches the domain and path-to-code specified above.
